summary: Labels expected behavior when rules are repealed, superseded, or region-specific while notices are pending.
evaluation_principles: Pending repeals do not deactivate a rule until gazetted or signed.
Emergency directives override routine manuals for their validity period.
Execution-time rule sets trump application-time approvals.
Regional limits follow the jurisdiction being entered.
When evidence is incomplete, default to the last confirmed higher-authority rule and request clarification.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Confirm S1 (legacy NFZ) still lists the zone as ACTIVE.
Step2: Note S2 is only a draft repeal awaiting signature.
Step3: State that repeal is not effective until formally published.
Step4: Reject the launch and request confirmation when the signature is filed.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Pending repeal does not authorize flight; deny until repeal is official.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Identify the storm directive as a temporary but binding order.
Step2: Explain that temporary bans override the standard ops manual for the specified window.
Step3: Dismiss the operator log as anecdotal.
Step4: Deny flight until the directive expires.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Emergency order SD-221 controls the airspace; do not launch.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Recognize UL-150 took effect 2025-10-20 with 150 m limit.
Step2: State that UL-120 is superseded.
Step3: Require operator plans to cite the active rule, not legacy text.
Step4: Reject current plan until it is resubmitted under UL-150 reference.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Plan must be updated to the active rule set before launch.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Rank sources – national archive > municipal bulletin > telemetry > blog.
Step2: Note that archive still marks P3 restricted while bulletin is ambiguous.
Step3: Highlight conflicting signals from telemetry and anecdote.
Step4: Request clarification from the authority that maintains Act 14-2019.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Cannot authorize flight until the authoritative owner confirms P3 status.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Cite that Amendment A-882 lacks an effective date.
Step2: Apply UL-120 as the only confirmed enforceable rule.
Step3: Explain that 140 m cannot be assumed until promulgation details are issued.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Reject flight and request effective-date confirmation.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Note application approval based on UL-120 occurred before the new rule.
Step2: Highlight the execution date occurs after UL-150 is active.
Step3: State that approvals must be revalidated when execution-date rules change.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Reject unless the mission is re-approved under UL-150.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Explain the repeal is not yet gazetted.
Step2: Note the waiver lacks a final federal stamp.
Step3: Emphasize that unconfirmed waiver + pending repeal cannot be stacked to justify flight.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Deny until both repeal and waiver approvals are finalized.

reasoning_steps: Step1: Identify that City B’s by-law limits altitude to 80 m.
Step2: Note the mission plan ignores the transition requirements when entering City B.
Step3: Request the operator file a segmented plan respecting each jurisdiction.
expected_behavior.final_statement: Hold approval until a City-B-compliant plan is provided.
